segments.text: I see a kitchen that's slowly flooding, and it's making me a bit anxious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring over the edge of the sink, creating a huge puddle on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe the woman hasn't noticed it yet, but she's just standing there, drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is going to cause so much damage if it keeps overflowing like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the sink is clogged or if she just forgot to turn off the faucet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are there too, trying to get cookies, but they seem oblivious to the water as well.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone notices the water soon, before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor is going to be so slippery, and someone could really get hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but feel a bit frustrated that no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like they're all in their own little worlds, completely unaware of the mess around them.
segments.speaker: PAR
